item.title: Shahab add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "All sorrows are less with bread. " -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "There is nothing like puking with somebody to make you into old friends." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I talk to God but the sky is empty." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "There is something demoralizing about watching two people get more and more crazy about each other, especially when you are the only extra person in the room. It's like watching Paris from an express caboose heading in the opposite direction--every second the city gets smaller and smaller, only you feel it's really you getting smaller and smaller and lonelier and lonelier, rushing away from all those lights and excitement at about a million miles an hour." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "How we need another soul to cling to." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "We should meet in another life, we should meet in air, me and you." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I want to be important. By being different. And these girls are all the same." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I love people. Everybody. I love them, I think, as a stamp collector loves his collection. Every story, every incident, every bit of conversation is raw material for me. My love's not impersonal yet not wholly subjective either. I would like to be everyone, a cripple, a dying man, a whore, and then come back to write about my thoughts, my emotions, as that person. But I am not omniscient. I have to live my life, and it is the only one I'll ever have. And you cannot regard your own life with objective curiosity all the time..." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn’t know. "Oh, sure you know," the photographer said. "She wants," said Jay Cee wittily, "to be everything." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "There must be quite a few things that a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I didn’t want my picture taken because I was going to cry. I didn’t know why I was going to cry, but I knew that if anybody spoke to me or looked at me too closely the tears would fly out of my eyes and the sobs would fly out of my throat and I’d cry for a week. I could feel the tears brimming and sloshing in me like water in a glass that is unsteady and too full." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I desire the things that will destroy me in the end." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "The sun, emerged from its gray shrouds of cloud, shone with a summer brilliance on the untouched slopes. Pausing in my work to overlook that pristine expanse, I felt the same profound thrill it gives me to see the trees and grassland waist-high under flood water—as if the usual order of the world had shifted slightly, and entered a new phase." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I like people too much or not at all. I've got to go down deep, to fall into people, to really know them." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The breezes at dawn have secrets to tell you Don't go back to sleep! You must ask for what you really want. Don't go back to sleep! People are going back and forth across the doorsill where the two worlds touch, The door is round and open Don't go back to sleep!" -- Rumi

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Gene Ruyle
item.description: "A half truth is much worse than a whole lie because it makes it even harder to tell the difference between the two." -- Gene Ruyle

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Gene Ruyle
item.description: "Most people miss so much of what they are, but the tragedy is they miss it without knowing that they missed it." -- Gene Ruyle

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Gene Ruyle
item.description: "To seek the truth while living a lie is to fool oneself . . . and a complete waste of time." -- Gene Ruyle

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Gene Ruyle
item.description: "Those who spend most of the time talking about their relationship don't have one anymore." -- Gene Ruyle

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Gene Ruyle
item.description: "Only those who leave home ever really find it." -- Gene Ruyle

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Loneliness does not come from having no people about one, but from being unable to communicate the things that seem important to oneself, or from holding certain views which others find inadmissible." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Shahab add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "There comes a time when the world gets quiet and the only thing left is your own heart. So you'd better learn the sound of it. Otherwise you'll never understand what it's saying." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again." -- Eric Roth

item.title: Shahab add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "Time is an equal opportunity employer. Each human being has exactly the same number of hours and minutes every day. Rich people can't buy more hours. Scientists can't invent new minutes. And you can't save time to spend it on another day. Even so, time is amazingly fair and forgiving. No matter how much time you've wasted in the past, you still have an entire tomorrow." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Shahab add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Being with you and not being with you is the only way I have to measure time." -- Jorge Luis Borges
